intro: Dischistocalyx ruellioides, commonly known as the African wild mango, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces edible fruits that are yellow when ripe, containing a single seed surrounded by a fleshy pulp. It is often grown for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in some regions. Its botanical features make it a notable species within its native habitat.
